etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in James Dana (1813–1895), geologist, zoologist, and teacher. From German Rammelsbergit from the name of K. F. Rammelsberg, German mineralogist + -it

definitions: A rare nickeliferous mineral occurring as white or silvery-grey granular or fibrous masses.

notes.text: Rammelsbergite is an arsenide of nickel, NiAs₂. Crystal system: orthorhombic.
